articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Benin
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Benin
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greeting to Thomas Boni Yayi, president of the Republic of Benin, on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message wished the president and people of Benin successes in their work for the socio-political development and prosperity and expressed the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Swiss President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Swiss President
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greeting to Simonetta Sommaruga, president of the Swiss Confederation, on Friday on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished the president and people of Swiss successes in their work for the country's prosperity.

articles.title: Reception Given by Country Director of Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation in DPRK
articles.content:
Reception Given by Country Director of Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Thomas Fisler, country director of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation in the DPRK, gave a reception Friday at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on the occasion of the national day of Switzerland. 
					 Present there on invitation were Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Present there were members of the Swiss embassy and agency.

articles.title: DPRK Players Prove Successful at FINA World Championships
articles.content:
DPRK Players Prove Successful at FINA World Championships
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- DPRK player Kim Kuk Hyang on Thursday placed the first at the diving women's 10m platform finals of the 16th FINA World Championships.
					 Kim Un Hyang and Song Nam Hyang bagged bronze medals at the diving women's 10 meter synchro platform event. 
					
					 The world championships started in Kazan, Russia on July 24. They brought together more than 2 600 men and women players from over 190 countries and regions including the DPRK, Mexico, Spain, Australia, Ukraine and Canada.

articles.title: Delegation of Karate-Do Association of Koreans in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of Karate-Do Association of Koreans in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Karate-Do Association of Koreans in Japan led by Managing Director Song Su Il visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung, on Friday.
					 At the old home of the President in Mangyongdae, the guests looked round historic relics preserved there, being briefed on the revolutionary history of the President and the patriotic life of his family members.
					
					 At the end of the visit Song said:
					
					 Whenever I visit the old home of the President in Mangyongdae, I keenly feel the undying exploits he performed by liberating the country and dedicating himself to it and its people all his life.
					
					 Visiting the homeland this year that marks the 60th anniversary of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), we more ardently yearn for the President and leader Kim Jong Il who formed Chongryon and guided its work step by step.
					
					 We will discharge our responsibility and duty in the drive to usher in a new heyday of Chongryon, true to the intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: President of World Chess Federation Leaves
articles.content:
President of World Chess Federation Leaves
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Kirsan Ilyumzhinov, president of the World Chess Federation, and his party left here on Friday.

articles.title: Vietnamese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Vietnamese Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Vietnamese newspaper Nhan Dan led by Deputy Editor-in-Chief Phan Huy Hien left here for home Friday.

articles.title: New Posters Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
New Posters Produced in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House has produced new posters.
					 Poster "Celebration of 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation" depicts the Arch of Triumph in its center against the background of fireworks displayed in the nocturnal sky and magnolias, national flower of Korea, in its lower part.
					
					 Poster "Let us Turn Wonsan Area into World-class City!" calls on the entire party and nation to the drive for building the Wonsan area as a world-class tourist zone.

articles.title: New Science Films Produced in DPRK
articles.content:
New Science Films Produced in DPRK
Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Korean Documentary and Science Film Studio has recently produced new science films.
					 They include "Child Health and Nutrition Care" (Part 1), "Nano Koryo Medicine with Immediate Effect" and "Peculiar Decoration Paints".
					
					 The films would be helpful to the improvement of people's health and their material and cultural life.

articles.title: Results of 2015 ITTF World Tour in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Results of 2015 ITTF World Tour in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Following are the results from the 16 superstar tournament in senior men's and women's singles of the GAC Group 2015 ITTF World Tour held here on Friday:
					 
					
					 - Senior men's singles 
					
					Ri Kwang Won (DPRK) : Chen Peng (China)       4:2
					
					Pak Sin Hyok (DPRK) :  Ro Hyon Song (DPRK)   4:1
					
					An Ji Song (DPRK) :  Le Tien Dat (Vietnam)      1:4
					
					Kim Hyok Jun (DPRK) :  Zhang Fuzhou (China)    2:4
					
					Kang Wi Hun (DPRK) :  Geng Zihao (China)       0:4
					
					Kim Hyong Jin (DPRK) :  Guo Wen (China)        2:4
					
					O Chol Min (DPRK) :   Cao Wei (China)           4:2
					
					Choe Il (DPRK) :  Ji Jiale (China)                 4:0
						
					
					 - Senior women's singles 
					
					Cha Hyo Sim (DPRK) :  Li Jiayuan (China)        4:1
					
					Kim Nam Hae (DPRK) :  Sun Yizhen (China)      4:2
					
					Kim Mun Yong (DPRK) :  He Zhuojia (China)     0:4
					
					Ri Myong Sun (DPRK) :  Yu Yong Sun (DPRK)    4:0
					
					Kim Hye Song (DPRK) :  Sun Chen (China)       2:4
					
					Kim Song I (DPRK) :  Cui Xuecong (China)       4:1
					
					Ri Hyon Sim (DPRK) :  Guo Yan (China)          4:1
					
					Ri Mi Gyong (DPRK) : Ri Pok Hyang (DPRK)      4:1
						
					
					 Meanwhile, there were competitions in senior men's and women's doubles. Following are pairs who advanced into the quarterfinals:
						
					
					 - Men's doubles 
					
					Pak Sin Hyok, Choe Il  (DPRK)
					
					Ri Kwang Won, O Chol Min (DPRK)
					
					Kang Wi Hun, Kwon Ryong Song (DPRK)
					
					An Ji Song, Ro Hyon Song (DPRK)
					
					   Chen Peng, Guo Wen (China)
					
					Geng Zihao, Zhang Fuzhou (China)
					
					Cao Wei, Ji Jiale (China)
					
					   Edric Lim Zheng Jie, Maxxe Tay Ming Han (Singapore)
						
					
					- Women's doubles 
					
					    Ri Mi Gyong, Kim Hye Song (DPRK)
					
					    Choe Hyon Hwa, Yu Yong Sun (DPRK)
					
					    Jong Un Ju, Ri Hyon Sim (DPRK)
					
					    Ri Myong Sun, Kim Song I (DPRK)
					
					     Guo Yan, Sun Yizhen (China)
					
					     Cui Xuecong, He Zhuojia (China)
					
					     Li Jiayuan, Sun Chen (China)
					
					     Mai Hoang My Trang, Nguyen Thi Nga (Vietnam)

articles.title: Maritime Sports Activities Brisk at Schools in DPRK
articles.content:
Maritime Sports Activities Brisk at Schools in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Schools in the DPRK are putting efforts to maritime sports activities.
					 On the occasion of July and August, months for maritime physical culture, schools have been giving efforts to encouraging swimming among students so that they can swim well and keep their bodies fit.
					
					 Schools effectively give sports lessons and operate swimmers' groups in order to help all students acquire good swimming abilities.
					
					 Teachers teach students how to swim and arrange various swimming games, helping them cultivate the spirit of collectivism and perseverance.
					
					 Schools also operate the swimming pools they built to suit their own conditions and incite students' enthusiasm for swimming.

articles.title: Brilliant Life of Kang Pan Sok
articles.content:
Brilliant Life of Kang Pan Sok
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of people is visiting the Chilgol, Mangyongdae and Ponghwa revolutionary sites in Pyongyang on the occasion of the 83rd anniversary of the demise of Kang Pan Sok (April 21, 1892-July 31, 1932), the outstanding leader of the Korean women's movement.
					 She helped revolutionary activities of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter, and President Kim Il Sung, as a wife of a revolutionary and a mother of a revolutionary and took active part in revolutionary activities.
					
					 With the assistance of Kim Il Sung, she organized the anti-Japanese women's association and led the Korean women to the struggle for achieving national liberation and social emancipation.
					
					  Though she suffered from serious illness, she dedicated herself to the foundation of the Anti-Japanese People's Guerrilla Army to be led by Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Kim Il Sung in his reminiscences "With the Century" said:
					
					 I would renew my resolve by recalling the words my mother had said to me as she pushed me off to south Manchuria, and the last image of my mother dressed in white seeing me off, before seeking recourse to an ideology or philosophical proposition.
					
					 As his mother wished, Kim Il Sung liberated Korea from the Japanese colonial rule by leading the anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory and founded the dignified DPRK.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korean Regime's Conspiratorial Racket against DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Slams S. Korean Regime's Conspiratorial Racket against DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Park Geun Hye-led regime of south Korean is becoming ever more frantic in its smear campaign against the DPRK by hurling "defectors from the north" into pulling up the DPRK over its "human rights performance."
					 As known, the puppet regime has hosted a plot-breeding UN "office for human rights performance in the north." It faked up the "2015 white paper on human rights in the north" peppered with lies and fabrications presented by human scum to malignantly slander the dignity and social system of the DPRK.
					
					 It sponsored a series of farces against the DPRK such as international meeting, seminar, briefing and photo exhibition dealing with the "issue of human rights in the north" in south Korea and abroad. There it let the riff-raffs that defected to south Korea make "testimonies" to distort the actual human rights situation in the DPRK and run the whole gamut of invectives tarnishing its image.
					
					 It is scheming to inveigle more "defectors from the north" living in foreign countries into its smear campaign against the DPRK by persuading them to come to south Korea. 
					
					 It is also getting undisguised in using human scum as a shock brigade for escalating the "confrontation of social systems" and realizing "unification by absorption".
					
					 Not content with hurling die-hard "defectors from the north" into smear campaign against the DPRK, it is militarily training the youngsters it lured and abducted, imbuing them with confrontational spirit.
					
					 It frequently let human scum make "testimonies" at the "National Assembly", saying "human rights performance in the north is the world's worst." It is escalating its confrontation with the compatriots in the north to an extreme pitch by setting up an "office for storing north's human rights records" and funding the anti-DPRK human rights conspiratorial bodies.
					
					 The Park regime is, indeed, the one of the worst human rights abusers as it is instigating the citizens of the DPRK it took to south Korea through appeasement and deception and by force to escalate confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 All the preceding chief executives of south Korea resorted to conspiratorial racket against the DPRK, but there was no such confrontation maniac as Park who made it a state policy to use "defectors from the north" as a shock brigade that plays a flagship role in stoking "confrontation of social systems" and realizing the "unification by absorption", and worked hard to carry it out.
					
					 "Protection of human rights of defectors from the north" much touted by the Park regime is no more than a sly artifice to get a "legal justification" for the crimes it perpetrated by luring and abducting citizens of the DPRK.
					
					 Lurking behind the regime's base moves is its sinister design to tarnish the image of the dignified DPRK under the pretext of "human rights issue" and realize its wild ambition for "unification by absorption."
					
					 However, it is no more than a pipedream of psychopaths that can never come true.
					
					 Poor, indeed, is the plight of the Park regime that has to use even human scum.
					
					 The regime is bound to pay dearly for its reckless conspiratorial racket against the DPRK.

articles.title: Military Commentator Ridicules U.S., S. Korea's Farce of Painting Defeat as "Victory"
articles.content:
Military Commentator Ridicules U.S., S. Korea's Farce of Painting Defeat as "Victory" 
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson on Friday carries an article of a military commentator critical of the U.S. and south Korea's shameful farce on the occasion of July 27.
					 When the world sent hearty congratulations to the army and people of the DPRK, the U.S. and south Korean puppet group ran the whole gamut of gimmick to get rid of disgrace and infamy as wretched losers, the article says.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korea resorted to a host of farces and burlesques to paint their setback and defeat in the Korean war as "military achievement" and "victory", the article notes, bringing to light part of those farces as follows:
					
					 A farce in Washington began with an event called "memorial wall".
					
					 The "memorial wall" was a "brainchild" of U.S. Congress to build a wall just as an endless long fence surrounding a cemetery as it was thought impossible to engrave all the names of the U.S. imperialist aggressors who were dead, crippled and went missing in the Korean war on a plane board. 
					
					 When the public was against the engraving of the names that totaled 36 574, the tricksters suggested an unusual event of "calling the names" in a bid to turn the public in their favor.
					
					 "Name-calling" place was the "Korean War Memorial Park."
					
					 The aged suffering from nightmares every July 27 had to gather there for four days to hear the names of the dead, rubbing their eyes and yawning.
					
					 The tricksters decided to hold a ground-breaking ceremony for "the monument to entry into the Korean front" in a national park of San Francisco on July 11.
					
					 The reason was that a "golden gate bridge" symbolic of San Francisco was the last thing the U.S. imperialist aggressors saw in their mainland before they were dispatched to the Korean war.
					
					 The farce-makers also decided to hold a ground-breaking ceremony for a two-meter-high "monument to the battle in Lake Jangjin" in Virginia on July 27.
					
					 The bitter defeat divisions of the U.S. imperialist aggressors sustained in Lake Jangjin during their northward advance, being seized by aggression and war hysteria, was a continuation of horrible nightmares unprecedented in the U.S. history.
					
					 The number of those who were frozen to death in Lake Jangjin was much more than that of those who were shot to death.
					
					 No wonder, survivors from the battle were so fear-stricken that they recalled time and again that the cold in Lake Jangjin was the most severe one in the world incomparable with that in the North and South poles.
					
					 As far as the "heroes of Lake Jangjin" highly praised by the U.S. are concerned, they are no more than forlorn wandering spirits as their remains have long been left as food for dogs there.
					
					 Park Geun Hye, to chime in with the above-said U.S.-sponsored farce, dispatched Kim Mu Song, representative of the "Saenuri Party," as her "special envoy" to the U.S. 
					
					 During his visit to the "village for warriors of services" in the U.S., Kim went busy flattering the U.S., making deep bows even with his nose close to the ground here and there, saying Koreans have an old custom of making deep bows in token of their "respect" and "gratitude." 
					
					 He even visited the Arlington National Cemetery, where others hesitate to go, to pay condolences to the dead in the Korean war. There he talked such nonsense as "invincible and unparalleled alliance" and "Washington political party diplomacy."
					
					 Great irony is Park Geun Hye's behavior.
					
					 Park reportedly seemed to be so anxious about her dropping behind Kim in the "race of loyalty to the U.S." that she even lost her appetite as honey-tongued Kim perfectly curried favor with the U.S. during his visit.
					
					 The puppet regime has opened a "special exhibition."
					
					 The thing that plays a leading role there is just a newly made piano.
					
					It is said that the piano's strings are made from rusty hedgehogs that had been set up along the 38th parallel by melting it.
					
					 The puppet regime once made the "medal for veterans", a scrap iron medal, by melting pieces of "rusty hedgehog" that had been installed along the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 Ringing out from the piano with "rusty hedgehog" label, the only one in the world, will be only a funeral song filled with sigh resulting from ignominious defeat.
					
					 The puppet regime also sponsored a "ceremony" to which it invited those of the U.S. allies that had participated in the Korean war and their 150 odd family members.
					
					 There it conferred "orders of merits" upon four of them, living corpses who could remain alive as they took to flight pell-mell from battlefields of the Korean war they had gone to make a petty amount of dollars.
					
					 The regime seemed to have calculated that such a farce might convert the nightmare of their defeat into a glorious "victory." Those who orchestrated the farce made no scruple of doing such base acts as to provide youngsters with the baton of defeat, as evidenced by the fact that it invited 100 odd school youth and children from the U.S. satellite countries to a "ceremony for peace camping" and incited war fever among them. 
					
					 The camping took place allegedly for "peace-making" but, in essence, it was one for eulogizing the Korean war as the sacred one for "defending freedom", "consoling" the souls of those who met ignominious deaths in an alien land and praising the "victory won at considerable sacrifice".
					
					 The military commentator says that history is fair and immutable, adding:
					
					 The bluffing made by the U.S. that it would occupy the whole land of Korea in just 72 hours turned into the sigh of loser who suffered only shame and defeats for 1 129 days, not just for 720 days.
					
					 The U.S. activated one third of its imperialist aggression forces, one fifth of the air force, most of the Pacific Fleet, the mercenary troops of its 15 satellite countries, tens of billions of U.S. dollars worth of military spending and tens of millions of tons of war supplies but could not but sign the surrender document. Its history of defeat can never be rewritten.
					
					 The more frantically the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces cling to the poor burlesque on the occasion of July 27, the more glaringly they would reveal their despicable nature as losers.
					
					 July 27 will remain forever as the v-day of heroic Korea which created the myth of invincibility.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Lauds Kim Il Sung's Songun Leadership Feats
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Lauds Kim Il Sung's Songun Leadership Feats
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The service persons and people of the DPRK prevailed over the U.S. imperialist aggressors who boasted of being the "strongest" in the world in the Korean war in the 1950s and won a shining victory, a historic event that honorably defended freedom and independence of the country and demonstrated to the whole world the spirit of independence of the nation and its indomitable will.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in an article.
					
					 The shining victory in the Fatherland Liberation War would have been unthinkable apart from the great Songun revolutionary leadership by the Workers' Party of Korea, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Songun is the most correct idea and line the WPK has steadily pursued and applied in the whole course of leading the revolution and construction. The sacred struggle of the Korean revolution characterized the annals of the victory of Songun that has advanced defying all difficulties and challenges of history by holding fast to the arms.
					
					 It was thanks to the red flag of Songun held aloft by President Kim Il Sung in Mt. Paektu and which fluttered as the banner of victory that the DPRK, once eclipsed in the world map, emerged as an example of the world in socialist construction and the Korean people, once fated to be a lesser nation, grew to be dignified independent ones.
					
					 The President consistently maintained the line of attaching importance to the arms and military affairs, led to victory two-revolutionary wars and two rehabilitation and construction and two-stage social revolution and socialist construction and thus put the sovereignty and dignity of the country and nation on the highest level. These undying feats in the history of the nation will always shine as the solid foundation for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Brands U.S. as Terrorist Sponsor
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Brands U.S. as Terrorist Sponsor
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the French magazine Le Point and an Algerian internet paper in articles said the list of "sponsors of terrorism" worked out by the U.S. is in its own interests and that American view on value can not be a global one. The articles noted:
					 The U.S. is styling itself "a power" but it is, in fact, a completely degenerated country in moral aspect. The U.S. which was founded based on terrorism has a college for training terrorists. It, therefore, has no justification to brand others as "terrorist states" and the view on value preached by it can not be a global one.
					
					 On the whole, the U.S. is a sponsor of terrorism, the most dangerous terrorist state in the world.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday in a commentary terms this due estimation for the U.S.
					
					 Citing facts to expose that the U.S. history is the one of terrorism in the literal sense of the word and its foreign policy is consistent with terrorism, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The list of "sponsors of terrorism" which the U.S., the hotbed of terrorism, works out to meet American-style standard is little short of a tentacle to interfere in the internal affairs of other countries.
					
					 It is just because of the U.S. that terrorism stalks and the evil cycle of revenge persists in the international arena.
					
					 The international community should punish the U.S.
					
					 Only doing so will check the U.S. policy of terrorism and ensure global peace and security.

articles.title: Peaceful Reunification of Korea Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Peaceful Reunification of Korea Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- People from all walks of life in Ulsan area, south Korea held a meeting on July 25 at which they called for peaceful reunification of the Korean peninsula.
					 Speakers underscored the need to make this year a year of putting an end to confrontation between the south and the north, achieving reconciliation, defusing military tensions and creating circumstances for peaceful reunification on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 Workers, artistes, students and schoolchildren in Ulsan area, 615 in all, sang in chorus.
					
					 Its participants expressed the will to preserve and implement the June 15 joint declaration and achieve reunification, the cherished desire of the nation, at an early date.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Protest "Katsura-Taft Treaty"
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Protest "Katsura-Taft Treaty"
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Peaceful Unification of Tangun's Nation and other national organizations in south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on July 29 to condemn the U.S. and Japanese criminal acts.
					 They charged that the Korean nation was subject to slavery under the colonial rule by the Japanese imperialists due to the "Katsura-Taft Treaty" concluded between the U.S. and Japan in 1905 and has suffered a tragedy of national split for 70 years.
					
					 Far from making apology and reparation, Japan is hell bent on the moves for reinvading the Korean peninsula, shamelessly tampering with history and running amuck to grab Tok Islets, they held.
					
					 They accused Japan of making desperate efforts to revive militarism under the patronage of the U.S., trumpeting about the "right to collective self-defense".
					
					 They dismissed the "Katsura-Taft Treaty" as invalid as it was concluded irrespective of the will of the Korean nation.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. and Japan make an apology to the Korean nation.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korean Diplomatic Authorities' Confab for Pressing DPRK Slammed
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korean Diplomatic Authorities' Confab for Pressing DPRK Slammed
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea staged a demonstration before the building of the puppet Ministry of Foreign Affairs on July 27 in denunciation of the U.S.-south Korean diplomatic authorities' confab for intensifying sanctions and pressure against the DPRK.
					 The special envoy of the six-party talks of the U.S. Department of State visited south Korea on July 26 and discussed with riff-raffs of the puppet Ministry of Foreign Affairs the issue for increasing the efficiency of sanctions and pressure against the DPRK.
					
					 The organization charged that "leading the north to dialogue through pressure and sanctions" means intensifying the policy against the DPRK.
					
					 It urged the south Korean and the U.S. authorities to immediately roll back their policies driving the situation only into confrontation.

articles.title: V-Day of DPRK Observed by Uruguayan and Russian Papers
articles.content:
V-Day of DPRK Observed by Uruguayan and Russian Papers
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- Uruguayan and Russian newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Uruguayan newspaper La Juventud on July 26 dedicated one whole page to an article titled "Peerless strategist" illustrated with a photo of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The article said that the DPRK won a miraculous victory in the hard-fought war against the imperialist allied forces headed by the U.S. which had had powerful military muscle, economic strength and long history of invasion and it is just attributable to the President's outstanding strategies, tactics and military war methods. 
					
					 The article went on;
					
					 When the U.S. ignited the Korean war at dawn on June 25, 1950 by prodding the south Korean puppet army, the President set forth a strategic policy for the Korean People's Army to switch to a counteroffensive immediately.
					
					 This was a new and original strategy of counteroffensive that could not be found in the existing military theories and manuals and war experience of other countries.
					
					 The numerical and technical advantages of the U.S. which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world were completely overwhelmed by the strategic and tactical advantages of the Korean People's Army led by the President.
					
					 The Russian newspaper Rio Panorama on July 24 said in an article titled "Bitter defeat of U.S." that the wretched defeat of the U.S. in the Korean war recorded one indelible page of history.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Highly Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Highly Praised by British Organization
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted an article titled "Great years" on its internet homepage on July 21 on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The article said that President Kim Il Sung was a peerless patriot and invincible and iron-willed commander as he firmly defended the destiny of the country and nation and worked military miracles to be specially recorded in the history of the anti-imperialist struggle by leading the Fatherland Liberation War to victory.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The victory in the Fatherland Liberation War was a brilliant one of idea, faith, strategies, tactics and commanding art of the President.
					
					 He brought about the day of second liberation by defeating the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and opened a new era of upswing in the anti-imperialist struggle. Such war victory exploits performed by him is unprecedented in the history of the Korean nation and human politics.
					
					 That's why the south Korean people, too, regard July 27 as day of the great victory when the U.S. myth of "mightiness" was shattered and the dignity and sovereignty of the nation were defended.
					
					 And they highly praise the President as a peerlessly great man who defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialism in one generation and a peerless hero to be glorified long in the history of the nation.

articles.title: Indonesian Politician Urges U.S. Not to Forget Historical July 27
articles.content:
Indonesian Politician Urges U.S. Not to Forget Historical July 27
 Pyongyang, July 31 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and its followers should not forget the historical July 27.
					 Ristiyanto, secretary general of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, said this in a statement on Monday, the 62nd anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The world remembers the shameful history in which the U.S. ignited a war against the young Democratic People's Republic of Korea only to fall on its knees before the heroic Korean people and sign the Armistice Agreement.
					
					 Many years have passed and one generation was replaced by the other several times but the victorious July 27 deeply reminds one of the truth of history that the just cause for defending the sovereignty and happiness of the country and people is sure to win.
					
					 But the U.S. and other hostile forces are straining the situation on the Korean peninsula extremely by staging joint military maneuvers under various codenames, being oblivious of the bitter defeat they sustained in the past Korean war. 
					
					 We strongly demand the U.S. immediately withdraw lethal equipment and aggression troops from south Korea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Benin por dia de independencia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita a presidente de Benin por dia de independencia 
Pyongyang, 31 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 29 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Benin, Thomas Boni Yayi, con motivo del aniversario 55 de la independencia de este pais.
					  El remitente desea al destinatario y a su pueblo los exitos en el trabajo para el desarrollo socio-economico y la prosperidad y expresa esperanza de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Benin sigan desarrollandose favorablemente.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a presidente suizo
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje a presidente suizo
Pyongyang, 31 de julio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 31 al presidente de la Confederacion Suiza, Simonetta Sommaruga, en ocasion de la fiesta nacional de este pais europeo.
					  El remitente desea al destinatario y a su pueblo los exitos en las labores para la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Jugadora de RPDC conquista medalla de oro en clavado
articles.content:
Jugadora de RPDC conquista medalla de oro en clavado
Pyongyang, 31 de julio (ACNC) -- La jugadora de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Kuk Hyang, obtuvo la medalla de oro en el clavado desde la plataforma fija de 10m (f) del XVI Campeonato Mundial de la Federacion Internacional de Natacion.
					En la final que tuvo lugar la vispera, la saltadora coreana vencio a todas sus rivales.
					
					Muchos especialistas, los aficionados y los espectadores felicitaron a Kim.
					
					Por otra parte, las jugadoras coreanas Kim Un Hyang y Song Nam Hyang recibieron las medallas de bronce en el salto simultaneo desde la plataforma fija de 10m (f).
					
					En la presenta cita deportiva, que es efectua desde el dia 24 en Kazan de Rusia, toman parte mas de 2,600 jugadores sobresalientes de ambos sexos provenientes de mas de 190 paises y regiones inclusive la RPDC, Mexico, Espana, Australia, Ucrania y Canada.
